snippet: The Alabama Legislature finally moves to grant posthumous pardons, a confirmation of the travesty 80 years ago.
abstract: Editorial welcomes decision by Alabama Legislature to grant posthumous pardons to the Scottsboro Boys, nine black teenagers whose false rape convictions in 1931 stand as a stark reminder of racial injustice; holds pardons will not in any way deliver full justice to men and their families, they do confirm what happened in Scottsboro eight decades ago.
lead_paragraph: The Alabama Legislature finally moves to grant posthumous pardons, a confirmation of the travesty 80 years ago.

keywords.value: Scottsboro Boys Museum and Cultural Center (Scottsboro, Ala)
keywords.name: organizations
